title: Forces exerted between launcher and block

content.question: A launcher with mass <math alttext="m sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is suspended from the ceiling by a string, as shown. A block with mass <math alttext="m sub 2 is less than m sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is launched horizontally. At the moment of launch, the block has unknown speed <math alttext="v sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and the launcher has unknown speed <math alttext="v sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> in the opposite direction. Which of the following is a true statement about the forces exerted between the launcher and block?

choices.label: The launcher exerts a greater force on the block than the block exerts on the launcher.
The block exerts a greater force on the launcher than the launcher exerts on the block.
The block and the launcher exert forces of equal magnitude on each other.

The relative magnitude of the force exerted on the spring by the block and launcher cannot be determined without knowing <math alttext="v sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.

content.answer: The block and the launcher exert forces of equal magnitude on each other.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
